svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - June 8 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
June 8, 2024" date: "2024-06-08"
Eth News and Links
EOF included in Pectra upgrade , largest upgrade ever planned (19 EIPs), likely targeting Q1 2025
All core devs
â€¢ All core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) #189 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Prague scope finalized
after 6 months (Electra still to be finalized) EOF included in Pectra Nethermind , Besu , EthereumJS ,
Reth ( EOF benefits ) & Erigon support EOF before Verkle, Geth skeptical of upgrade size & priority of
EOF Discussed splitting Pectra, if EOF blocks Pectra move to separate upgrade EIP7702 included in
Pectra, replaces EIP3074, iterate on revocability design Pectra-devnet-1: will include
interop/devnet-0 spec changes, add EIP7702 (revocability may change) but exclude EOF (work on static
tests first) EIP158 state clearing : EOA with EIP7702 could be empty but have storage, may need to
remove EIP158 either with EIP7702 or Verkle EIP4444 history expiry : client teams working on Portal
network but have competing priorities ACD process improvements : new EIPs to be reviewed async, EIP
proposed for inclusion (PFI) status to be used in upgrade planning
â€¢ Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Prague scope finalized after 6 months (Electra still to be
finalized) EOF included in Pectra Nethermind , Besu , EthereumJS , Reth ( EOF benefits ) & Erigon
support EOF before Verkle, Geth skeptical of upgrade size & priority of EOF Discussed splitting
Pectra, if EOF blocks Pectra move to separate upgrade EIP7702 included in Pectra, replaces EIP3074,
iterate on revocability design Pectra-devnet-1: will include interop/devnet-0 spec changes, add
EIP7702 (revocability may change) but exclude EOF (work on static tests first)
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade :
â€¢ Prague scope finalized after 6 months (Electra still to be finalized)
Prague scope finalized after 6 months (Electra still to be finalized)
â€¢ EOF included in Pectra Nethermind , Besu , EthereumJS , Reth ( EOF benefits ) & Erigon support EOF
before Verkle, Geth skeptical of upgrade size & priority of EOF Discussed splitting Pectra, if EOF
blocks Pectra move to separate upgrade
EOF included in Pectra
â€¢ Nethermind , Besu , EthereumJS , Reth ( EOF benefits ) & Erigon support EOF before Verkle, Geth
skeptical of upgrade size & priority of EOF
Nethermind , Besu , EthereumJS , Reth ( EOF benefits ) & Erigon support EOF before Verkle, Geth
â€¢ Discussed splitting Pectra, if EOF blocks Pectra move to separate upgrade
Discussed splitting Pectra, if EOF blocks Pectra move to separate upgrade
â€¢ EIP7702 included in Pectra, replaces EIP3074, iterate on revocability design
EIP7702 included in Pectra, replaces EIP3074, iterate on revocability design
â€¢ Pectra-devnet-1: will include interop/devnet-0 spec changes, add EIP7702 (revocability may change)
but exclude EOF (work on static tests first)
Pectra-devnet-1: will include interop/devnet-0 spec changes, add EIP7702 (revocability may change) but
exclude EOF (work on static tests first)
â€¢ EIP158 state clearing : EOA with EIP7702 could be empty but have storage, may need to remove EIP158
either with EIP7702 or Verkle
EIP158 state clearing : EOA with EIP7702 could be empty but have storage, may need to remove EIP158
â€¢ EIP4444 history expiry : client teams working on Portal network but have competing priorities
EIP4444 history expiry : client teams working on Portal network but have competing priorities
â€¢ ACD process improvements : new EIPs to be reviewed async, EIP proposed for inclusion (PFI) status to
be used in upgrade planning
ACD process improvements : new EIPs to be reviewed async, EIP proposed for inclusion (PFI) status to
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade
â€¢ Future of EOA/AA breakout #4 (EIP7702): Concerns around revocability, use optional nonce unless
alternative found (max nonce & nonce manager non-starters), signing address vs code discussion &
wallet best practices
Future of EOA/AA breakout #4 (EIP7702):
â€¢ Concerns around revocability, use optional nonce unless alternative found (max nonce & nonce manager
non-starters), signing address vs code discussion &
â€¢ Alex Stokes: PeerDAS & raising blob count , proposal to decouple layers for setting blob count and
consensus clients to have maximum blob count flag for local block building
Alex Stokes: PeerDAS & raising blob count , proposal to decouple layers for setting blob count and
Osaka + F starname upgrade
â€¢ Verkle implementers call #18 : Conversion from Merkle state to Verkle took ~16 days, potential
EIP158 issue with EIP7702, warming system contracts & gas cost updates to EIP4762
â€¢ Conversion from Merkle state to Verkle took ~16 days, potential EIP158 issue with EIP7702, warming
system contracts & gas cost updates to EIP4762
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
â€¢ ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.92% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.92% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
â€¢ Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority Consensus layer:
Prysm 38% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
â€¢ Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
â€¢ Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
â€¢ Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
â€¢ Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
â€¢ ePBS ePBS breakout #2 : Prysm only client team to have started implementation Terence:
out-of-protocol timelines under ePBS , using MEV-Boost with ePBS is worst of both worlds
ePBS
â€¢ ePBS breakout #2 : Prysm only client team to have started implementation
ePBS breakout #2 : Prysm only client team to have started implementation
â€¢ Terence: out-of-protocol timelines under ePBS , using MEV-Boost with ePBS is worst of both worlds
Terence: out-of-protocol timelines under ePBS , using MEV-Boost with ePBS is worst of both worlds
â€¢ Portal network summit : History network & Beacon network largely feature complete, State network
initial phase targeting Devcon
Portal network summit : History network & Beacon network largely feature complete, State network
â€¢ Gossipsub performance : network dynamicity through GRAFTs & PRUNEs
Gossipsub performance : network dynamicity through GRAFTs & PRUNEs
Client Releases
â€¢ Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.19.0 : flood publish disabled by default, Nodejs v22 default and AMD64
& ARM64 binaries
Consensus layer:
â€¢ Lodestar v1.19.0 : flood publish disabled by default, Nodejs v22 default and AMD64 & ARM64 binaries
â€¢ Execution layer: Erigon v2.60.1 : set tracer-observable value of a delegatecall to match parent
value Geth v1.14.5 : hotfix for peer discovery; v1.14.4 :Â 5-7% faster block import speeds, ETH supply
live tracer and default minimum tip dropped to 0.001 gwei Reth v0.2.0-beta.9 : fix for docker;
v0.2.0-beta.8 : ensure Fork Choice Updated messages not missed when pruner active & changes to support
OP mainnet
Execution layer:
â€¢ Erigon v2.60.1 : set tracer-observable value of a delegatecall to match parent value
Erigon v2.60.1 : set tracer-observable value of a delegatecall to match parent value
â€¢ Geth v1.14.5 : hotfix for peer discovery; v1.14.4 :Â 5-7% faster block import speeds, ETH supply live
tracer and default minimum tip dropped to 0.001 gwei
Geth v1.14.5 : hotfix for peer discovery; v1.14.4 :Â 5-7% faster block import speeds, ETH supply live
â€¢ Reth v0.2.0-beta.9 : fix for docker; v0.2.0-beta.8 : ensure Fork Choice Updated messages not missed
when pruner active & changes to support OP mainnet
Reth v0.2.0-beta.9 : fix for docker; v0.2.0-beta.8 : ensure Fork Choice Updated messages not missed
For Stakers
â€¢ Anti correlation penalties to defend solo staker viability
Anti correlation penalties to defend solo staker viability
â€¢ Toni WahrstÃ¤tter: MEV-Boost vs local block building , only small increase in APY
Toni WahrstÃ¤tter: MEV-Boost vs local block building , only small increase in APY
Layer 2
â€¢ Consensys Linea paused sequencer & censored Velocore attacker addresses
Consensys Linea paused sequencer & censored Velocore attacker addresses
â€¢ Rollup.wtf dashboard : L2 real time performance showing TPS, MGas/s & KB/s
Rollup.wtf dashboard : L2 real time performance showing TPS, MGas/s & KB/s
EIPs/Standards
â€¢ EIPs: EIP7718 : Portal Wire Protocol a framework for discv5 EIP7719 : P2P History Network
â€¢ EIP7718 : Portal Wire Protocol a framework for discv5
EIP7718 : Portal Wire Protocol a framework for discv5
â€¢ EIP7719 : P2P History Network
EIP7719 : P2P History Network
Stuff for developers
â€¢ Foundry adds Vyper support : deploy, test, debug & write scripts
Foundry adds Vyper support : deploy, test, debug & write scripts
â€¢ Hardhat v2.22.5 : adds limited support for blob transactions & hardhat-tracer reenabled
Hardhat v2.22.5 : adds limited support for blob transactions & hardhat-tracer reenabled
â€¢ Slither v0.10.3 : reduces false positives & improves performance
Slither v0.10.3 : reduces false positives & improves performance
â€¢ Snekmate (Vyper building blocks): module-friendly contracts, uses Vyper v0.4.0rc6
Snekmate (Vyper building blocks): module-friendly contracts, uses Vyper v0.4.0rc6
â€¢ Prool : simulate local/bundler/indexer node over HTTP for TypeScript test runners e.g. Vitest
Prool : simulate local/bundler/indexer node over HTTP for TypeScript test runners e.g. Vitest
â€¢ EVMole : improved accuracy in function argument extraction
EVMole : improved accuracy in function argument extraction
â€¢ Contract read/write: Etherscan NatSpec comments used in read/write contract tab ABI Ninja : adds
proxy support, interact without an ABI & shareable link for contracts Evm.codes contract reader
Contract read/write:
â€¢ Etherscan NatSpec comments used in read/write contract tab
Etherscan NatSpec comments used in read/write contract tab
â€¢ ABI Ninja : adds proxy support, interact without an ABI & shareable link for contracts
ABI Ninja : adds proxy support, interact without an ABI & shareable link for contracts
â€¢ Evm.codes contract reader
Evm.codes contract reader
Security
â€¢ Velocore (DEX) $6.8M exploit on zkSync & Linea via faulty logic
Velocore (DEX) $6.8M exploit on zkSync & Linea via faulty logic
â€¢ Security Alliance (SEAL) partnership with Security Research Legal Defense Fund to assist whitehats
using safe harbor agreement
Security Alliance (SEAL) partnership with Security Research Legal Defense Fund to assist whitehats
Ecosystem
â€¢ Hackathon projects: ETH Belgrade , ETHDublin & ETHPrague
Hackathon projects: ETH Belgrade , ETHDublin & ETHPrague
â€¢ Devcon scholars program for community organizers, law students/legal professionals, artists/sci-fi
writers & builders, applications close July 7
Devcon scholars program for community organizers, law students/legal professionals, artists/sci-fi
â€¢ Interactive version of Ethereum roadmap
Interactive version of Ethereum roadmap
Job Listings
â€¢ Nethermind: Preconfirmations Senior Engineer , Protocol Researcher , Site Reliability Engineer ,
Research Engineer - Starknet & Senior Marketing Manager
Nethermind: Preconfirmations Senior Engineer , Protocol Researcher , Site Reliability Engineer ,
â€¢ Gnosis is hiring: Discord Moderator and Senior Web3 Software Dev (Wallet)
Gnosis is hiring: Discord Moderator and Senior Web3 Software Dev (Wallet)
â€¢ IMC: Quant Developer for DeFi and MEV focused team
IMC: Quant Developer for DeFi and MEV focused team
â€¢ Alchemy - Wallet Services: Engineering Manager and Full-Stack Engineer
Alchemy - Wallet Services: Engineering Manager and Full-Stack Engineer
â€¢ Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
â€¢ ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering , DevRel - Sygma and more jobs
ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering , DevRel - Sygma and more jobs
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
â€¢ Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 3.2 to 115.8 gwei, with 12.4 gwei average Zero net issuance
currently at 23.4 gwei 8k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 3.2 to 115.8 gwei, with 12.4 gwei average
â€¢ Zero net issuance currently at 23.4 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.4 gwei
â€¢ 8k ETH net issuance this week
8k ETH net issuance this week
â€¢ ETHUSD : $3,642 - $3,874, currently $3,686
ETHUSD : $3,642 - $3,874, currently $3,686
â€¢ ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
â€¢ IYK platform public, link physical items to digital using NFC chips
Regulation/business/tokens
â€¢ Stand with Crypto US reached 1M members
Stand with Crypto US reached 1M members
â€¢ Appellate court slaps down SEC regulatory overreach
Appellate court slaps down SEC regulatory overreach
â€¢ Evolved Apes creators charged in alleged NFT rug pull
Evolved Apes creators charged in alleged NFT rug pull
â€¢ Matter Labs (zkSync) dropping all trademark applications for ZK term
Matter Labs (zkSync) dropping all trademark applications for ZK term
General
â€¢ CoinGecko data breach via third-party email platform; name, email, IP & location of email opens
compromised
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-june-8-2024
